So, here it is -- Part One: The Shudder-Inducing and Cliched, However Totally False Account Of How I Lost My Virginity To A Guy At A Community College In A Neighboring Town. (Beat.) Let me just begin by saying that there are two sides to every story. This is my side, the right one. (Beat.) Like, totally. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Breathy and aping Marilyn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just realized the funniest thing. My name is an anagram for `I love...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's an anagram?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look it up, big boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rubs her knee, seductively, along his inner thigh, tu and licks her lips at a repulsed Rhiannon and continues o her way. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything sexually suggestive you can do with school cafet food, Olive does as she makes her way through the lunch l as guys ogle her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne, also present in the line, watches her in repugnance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive emerges from the GIRLS' LOCKER ROOM, dressed for gy class. A TERRIFIED FAT KID named EVAN nervously approache her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Olive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures for her to follow him underneath the bleacher She reluctantly does so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get mad, but Brandon told me what you did for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, rest assured, it was equally as thrilling for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he told me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pissed. She silently seethes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was just hoping that maybe you could do the same for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Through clenched teeth) Walk away, Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan starts to talk, but she raises her hand to silence h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUN away, Evan. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can pay you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm about six seconds away from slapping you so hard that your unborn grandchildren will feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Excited at the prospect) Can you do it in front of everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive turns and starts to leave. Evan summons up his cour and meekly states to her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need your permission, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around and gives him a look of death. He can't look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, at the rate you're going, I'm just saying I don't think anyone would not believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you threatening me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you $500.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're repugnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Indicating his body) That's the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And once again Olive feels too sorry for him to say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want five hundred dollars in gift certificate form deposited in my locker before noon tomorrow. Preferably `The Gap,' but I'll also take Amazon.com. We did NOT have sex. I was piss-ass drunk and I let you fondle my chest and it was a glorious moment for you, unmatched by anything you've heretofore experienced, including cake. Got it? 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred bucks for just feeling you up? Doesn't that seem a little steep to you? Can you throw in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mispronouncing it; as if it rhymed with `cottage') frottage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fraw-TAHZH, dumbass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. But it was so good, you lasted only twelve seconds and I better not find out that little pecker of yours EVER came out of your pants. Take it or leave it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little pecker? Nuh-uh. For five hundred dollars, it was ungodly huge. You even commented on the unusual girth for a guy my age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was too drunk to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She, repulsed by it, shakes his hand. Evan's ecstatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sad thing is, Evan, if you had been a gentleman and asked me out on a date, I probably would have said yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Do you want to go on a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With zero vitriol -- 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sad for him, she walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the webcam --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evan, if you're watching this - shame on you. I hope you never treat another girl the way you treated me or you will die alone, wishing it was because you're fat. And since we're playing the shame game... While I appreciate the sentiment, Lewis, a pretend hand job should have warranted a little more than a hundred dollars worth of AMC Movie Passes. They had an expiration date AND were only able to be used for movies that had been running for two weeks. But even that's better than Tyler Jennings, who gave me a ten percent off coupon to Bath and Body Works. Seriously. A fucking coupon. Is that how good my imaginary blow job was to you? Huh? Is chivalry dead? I want John Cusack holding a boombox outside my window. I want Richard Gere climbing up my fire escape with the limo waiting downstairs. I want to ride off on a lawnmower with Patrick Dempsey. Although, I'm ashamed to admit I'd prefer him to look like he looks now. What woman wouldn't? But no. I get to save two fifty on a bottle of Juniper Breeze Hand Lotion. Maybe chivalry isn't dead, but it's in a coma and the prognosis isn't good. (Beat.) So, if you're still with me - and I'm guessing that most of you are - I now present to you Part Four: How I, Olive Penderghast, Went From Assumed Trollop To an Actual Home- wrecker. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Griffin is alone grading papers. Olive pokes her head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, Olive. Come cop a squat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a seat opposite his desk. He points to the RED on her chest.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accessorizing?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Olive, Olive, Olive. Do you think that maybe you're reading a little too much into this assignment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm really hoping to get an A. (She points to her chest) Get it? Get it?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I'm hearing things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rumors are true. I am, in fact, considering becoming an existentialist.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: You know what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, since when did teachers become privy to idle, adolescent gossip?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I guess it wouldn't matter so much if I didn't like you. You're a great girl and I happen to think that all of

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Indicating her outfit) `this' is just an act. I'm just curious why you're doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive drops her defenses and gets real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever decided just to play along? Because it's maybe easier than fighting tooth-and-nail to defend it?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I just don't want to see this (He searches for the word) damage you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I think you should give me extra credit for going the extra mile. I'm really attempting to understand this puritanical ostracism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Griffin smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm really sorry I had to send you to the Principal. If you tell anybody, I'll deny it, but I really wanted to cheer with the rest of the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I won't tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and leaves, but passes in the doorway, a BEAUTIFUL WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the woman) Hey Mrs. Griffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretending to know who she is --

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Hi! How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing to the `A') A is for Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive disappears into the empty halls. 63.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I've never seen that girl before in my life.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: That doesn't surprise me.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I'm the guidance counselor. I should know all of the students. Especially the ones dressed like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: She's just going through a phase. (He gets an idea) Hey, do you think you could talk to her? Maybe you could get her to -- I dunno -

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Sure. Yeah, whatever. Oh wait! That's not the girl that everyone's talking about, is it?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: `Fraid so.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Oh, this'll be good. That snotty office aid has been bitching about her incessantly.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: It's all lies. Talk to her. Maybe that's all she needs.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: What are you making for dinner tonight?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Is it my turn?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Sure is. I'm meeting up with the girls at happy hour.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Don't have too much fun. 64.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: I never do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assembled in a semi-circle, a handful of WELL-DRESSED CHRISTIAN KIDS open their meeting of the CROSS YOUR HEART CLUB with prayer. Marianne, of course, leads them in this ritual. Nina is also present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavenly Father, watch over us with Your all-encompassing love. Keep us on the path toward Your righteousness and eternal salvation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all smile, say `AMEN' and open their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys. We have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen to THAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive Penderghast. We need to pray for her, but we also need to get rid of her. I'm sure, by now, you've all heard about what happened at Melanie Bostic's party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there. I heard the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne eyes him, suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not something you need to advertise, Kurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, herein lies the problem: She's doing these tasteless, immoral acts in plain view of the entire student body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in direct opposition to everything we're trying to do for this school, which is make it a wholesome learning environment and a place where our children will one day flourish the way that we are. (Beat.) She was sent to the Principal's office last week --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She called me a really hurtful name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and I tried to witness to her, but she's defiant to any sort of help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tears up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to do, but something's got to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her boyfriend, MICAH (17) takes her hand and holds it. Sh leans against his shoulder, wiping away tears. Nina, on t other side of her, begins rubbing her shoulder, sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anybody here think that they can talk to her in a way that might get her to see that what she's doing is wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She suddenly bursts into sobs. (And these aren't crocodil tears. She is flooded with emotion.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. This is so stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not, Marianne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wipes her tears away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus tells us to love everyone. Even the whores and the homosexuals, but it's so hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so hard, because they just keep doing `it' over and over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Micah and Nina's hands, the rest of the group follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make me a promise. Make GOD a promise right here and now that we will remain pure and chaste until marriage. (Looking to Micah) Until our love is proven holy in His eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's continue to pray for Olive Penderghast. That either she sees that what she's doing is a sin and changes her behavior or that she gets the hell out of our school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all squeeze hands and Marianne manages a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awww, I love you guys. God loves you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne gives Micah a strictly PG-rated kiss against his car. They're nauseatingly wholesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive is sitting in the office, dressed just as slutty as day before. A RED "A" sewn onto her top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne is behind the desk, sharpening pencils. After ea one, she observes the point with a scary satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange a few hateful glances at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Griffin pokes her head out of her office.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Hey Olive. Wanna come in? 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive, in no mood for this, drags herself up dramatically follows Mrs. Griffin into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Griffin sits behind her desk and Olive sits opposite her.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: So, the reason I called you down here is just so that we could - sort of, y'know - chat about what's going on. (Beat.) There's been some concern from faculty members.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Griffin shifts uncomfortably in her chair. There's something a little unnerving about this kid's awareness.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Olive, you're attempting to make a statement. We get that. I'm just confused as to what exactly it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I in trouble? I promise the hem of my dress isn't higher than my fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: You're not in trouble, Olive. I just wanted you to know that if there was something you maybe needed to talk about, that you could trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I open up to you, do you promise this stays in confidence?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watch `American Idol.' Do NOT tell anyone. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Griffin rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a reputation to uphold.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Don't you, though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive assesses this statement from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We done? If I can think of any angsty things to report, you'll be the first to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been so much fun that I'm actually - at this very moment - considering meth addiction, just so I can come back and we can jaw some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you could always get pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm probably closer than either of us thinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Griffin digs in her purse and pulls out a handful of CONDOMS. Feigning excitement --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Propho-tastic!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Please don't tell anyone I gave you these. The school board is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puritanical and oppressive?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Conservative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive sees that Mrs. Griffin is genuinely concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need those. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive starts to confess, but then just takes the rubbers puts them in her own purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Remember: our little secret. And, hey, would you send in the next person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Griffin smiles at Olive as she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne is talking to Micah, who seems distressed. He ru his eyes, like he's been crying. Olive is surprised to se him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're up, hoss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Concerned; To Micah) It's going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a reassuring smile and he walks into her office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess: drugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne gives her a `go away' look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know Christians believed in guidance counsellors. (Beat.) Ooo! Ooo! Is your boyfriend struggling with his sexuality?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne begins crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you insensitive rhymes-with- witch! His parents are going

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: divorce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins sobbing uncontrollably. Olive, not sure what t do, goes around the counter and hugs her. Marianne just cries on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Marianne. (Not sure what to say) Sometimes our boyfriend's parents get divorced. It's just important to know that it's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Through her tears) They go to our church! Imagine what people will say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive didn't expect this embrace to last this long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go now. Are you going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into Olive's shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Griffin is going to fix everything. She's amazing. I know that she's going to help Micah through this time and everything's going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Everything's going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne pulls away and wipes tears from her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you being so nice to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that what we're supposed to do? Hey, it's your boss's rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This triggers even more wails from Marianne , who grabs O and squeezes her tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, okay? I'm sorry for everything I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be friends. PLEASE. PLEASE be my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive is really confused by this display and is about to something snide, but thinks better of it and replies with very heartfelt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne pulls away again and manages to smile at her, warmly.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And for a day, we were actually really good friends. I was really starting to think that things were going to turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne, angry as hell, stomps through the hall with hat burning in her eyes and coursing through her veins.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But then I unwittingly gave her boyfriend a venerial disease...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne stops in front of Olive and slaps her so hard th people in the hallways stop, dead in their tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the slap heard `round the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive bursts into Mrs. Griffin's office. Tear-streaked, M Griffin is packing her things into a cardboard box. It's if her world has just collapsed.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...And caused the break-up of Mr. and Mrs. Griffin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive starts to say something, but Mrs. Griffin can't eve look at her.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just go! 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws a framed photo of her and Mr. Griffin into the box. It shatters. Mrs. Griffin falls apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive starts to say something again, but she doesn't know what to say, so she sheepishly turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cross Your Heart Club is assembled outside of the sch with a lot of other kids (and some parents), waving signs wooden stakes that say things like:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhi is among them, as riled up as any.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So, I guess I shouldn't be too shocked that these people wanted my diseased, home-wrecking ass out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene is a maelstrom of anger and piety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funny thing is: the whole time this shit was going down - people calling me something I knew wasn't true, my best friend included - I couldn't help but think how I could have come up with better signs. No one even bothered to use alliteration or, God forbid, irony - not even a single acronym - and that seems a lot more unforgivable than my sins. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive enters a Catholic Church. It's empty, but there are few CANDLES burning. She sees the CONFESSIONAL BOOTH and makes a beeline toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a deep breath and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down and begins to talk to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, father, for I have sinned. I think that's how you're supposed to start these things. I'm only going on what I've seen in the movies. Then, I think I'm supposed to tell you how long it's been since my last confession, but that's kind of my first confession. I'm not Catholic. I really don't know what I'm supposed to do, except sit here in this booth and tell you what I've done wrong. Where do I even start? (Beat.) I've been pretending to be a -- how would one phrase it in Catholic words? A harlot. It's not like I've actually been doing the things that people are saying I'm doing, but - then again - I'm not denying them, so I've just been wondering: is that wrong? There's a lot of shi -- `crap' going down at my school which may or may not be indirectly because of this masquerade. (Beat.) I'm lying. I may have caused the end of a marriage. I thought, in my own perverse way, that I could help it. I mean, in my defense, I am merely an adolescent. I should never have been propositioned in the way I was propositioned by an adult. But then again, I should never have consented. It was just that a lot of people had been asking me to do things and I thought it was okay, because it wasn't real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was make-believe and no one was getting hurt. But a lot of people hate me now. I kind of hate me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a long silence. Olive tears up and wipes them awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be wrong, but aren't you supposed to say something or ask me questions. Tell me to say `Hail Marys'? Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks through the screen. There's no one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws the curtain to the booth open and stomps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive, upset at herself, gets into her car and drives off But just a few blocks down the street to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She parks her car and gets out to try a different denomination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive enters to find a SWEET, PORTLY RECEPTIONIST (50's) searching through RELIGIOUS CLIP-ART on her COMPUTER, attempting to find the perfect image for the church newsletter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lady smiles, acknowledging Olive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I was wondering if the minister was around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pastor McGreevey is on vacation this week. But our associate pastor is in. Would you like to speak to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For her own entertainment, Olive matches the receptionist enthusiasm level. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, that would be fantastic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I tell him what this is regarding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I'm looking for a church to join and I thought he might be able to sell me on this fine establishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receptionist joyfully snatches up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don, there's a young lady here who would like to speak with you about joining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens and then hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pointing to an office) You can go right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If everyone here is as friendly as you, I think we might be in business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winks at the receptionist and enters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASSOCIATE PASTOR DON (40's) is a gangly, unattractive - borderline creepy - man. He invites Olive to have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: ASSOCIATE PASTOR DON
dialogues.text: Hello there, young lady. My name is Don.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He extends his hand, which she shakes politely.

dialogues.speaker: ASSOCIATE PASTOR DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How can I help you today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm new to the area. Looking for a church - hopefully something with a strong fellowship, a firm foot in the soil of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: divinity and was wondering what your church's stance on lying and adultery was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don seems taken aback by the question.

dialogues.speaker: ASSOCIATE PASTOR DON
dialogues.text: Well. It's not a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I agree. Wholeheartedly. But tell me: assuming there is a hell --

dialogues.speaker: ASSOCIATE PASTOR DON
dialogues.text: Ma'am, the Presbyterian Church recognizes the existence of hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Okay. Let's say hell exists. Which is worse - lying or adultery? Or is lying about adultery like a double whammy?

dialogues.speaker: ASSOCIATE PASTOR DON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, ma'am, I -- What did you say your name was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, Olive looks at his desk and sees a FRAMED FAMILY PHOTO. Smiling big are Associate Pastor Don, his wife, A WOMAN WITH A SMILE THE SIZE OF MONTANA and his lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps up from her chair and recoils at the sight of t picture and the stupid mistake she made by coming there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what. I think I'm just going to go and check out Judaism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backing up toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jews and I have a lot in common. Fashion-wise. And stuff. So, thank you for your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bolts from his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive speaks into her webcam -- 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I had unwittingly sought advice from the father of the leader of my lynch mob. Who else can say that's happened to them? (Beat.) As much as I want to say I hate Marianne. I don't. I get her. Well, I get certain things about her. She's passionate. Like myself. She always thinks she's right. Like myself. And, yeah, I can kind of understand why she slapped me that day. Here's what happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne, excitedly, runs over to Olive who is just getti to school and throws her arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Remember how I said that we were BFFs for, like, a day. Well, that's true. It was like we were sisters all of a sudden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne can't seem to break the embrace and Olive just g with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive sits in class. Marianne passes a note back to her.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She wrote me a note in first period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive reads it. It says: Hey girlie! You wanna hang out after school today? Kisses! Marianne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne looks back and Olive gives her the thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the room, Rhi sees this exchange and sneers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne is working with her partner, Evan. She turns to Olive behind them and makes a gagging signal behind his b and laughs silently. 78.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: By second period, it was like we had private jokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive, unaware of how to respond, gives another thumbs up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive sees Marianne come into class, tear-streaked. She r over to Olive and again throws her arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tragedy struck in third period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micah's in the hospital. He's in so much pain! The nurse didn't know what was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive just holds her new friend, as she had the day befor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Tears glistening in her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive guides Marianne's head back to her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne's boyfriend, Micah, writhes in pain on a hospita bed, clutching his crotch. His worried MOTHER (40's) is beside him, clutching her chest with one hand and trying soothe him with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR enters, with a satisfied smile and a diagnosis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chlamydia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micah and his mother both look up in shock. His mother ta both of her hands and begins slapping him, uncontrollably 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get chlamydia? Who have you been sleeping with? Tell me! TELL ME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micah, in pain from the burning sensation and his mother' hands flying at astonishing speed shouts out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive! Olive Penderghast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother's face fills with satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micah's mother is on her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive Penderghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She folds her phone up and slips it into her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman on the other end of the phone -- A WOMAN WITH A SMILE THE SIZE OF MONTANA -- who we've seen in the Bryant family photo, hangs up. Only this time, her smile is a disgusted grimace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the phone and dials a number. She is, animatedly, talking to the person on the other end of the line, while Olive narrates.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Fourth period was when Marianne had office duty. Her duties included typing, stapling, filing and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne is on the phone, listening, with mouth agape. Undoubtedly, she's just heard from her mother that her boyfriend has chlamydia.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- answering the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She screams so loud that Mrs. Griffin comes out of her office, a panicked expression on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seething, Marianne's mother says into the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive Penderghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears a slam and then a dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne clutches the phone in the cradle with enough for that it looks like the receiver will shatter in her hands Mrs. Griffin looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Are you okay, hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a teapot about to start expelling steam, Marianne quivers in rage. Finally, at boiling point, she shouts --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But her long string of profanities is muffled by the long ringing of the school bell. Mrs. Griffin is taken aback b Marianne's umbrage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we saw before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne, angry as hell, stomps through the hall with hat burning in her eyes and coursing through her veins.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, I exaggerated. We were just BFFs for, like, a half-a-day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne stops in front of Olive and slaps her so hard th people in the hallways stop, dead in their tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Clutching her face) MutherFUCKer! 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhi, who was loading books in her locker, sees this and happily slams her locker shut. Breezing past her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sentiments exactly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, grow up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Rhi keeps on walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micah's on his cell phone, anxiously talking to someone - checking every few seconds to see if his mom is on her wa out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into the cell phone) I didn't know what to say! I panicked! I said I got it from Olive Penderghast. (Pause.) I know, but what was I supposed to say?! And then my mom called her mom. (Pause.) No, not Olive's. Marianne's! (Pause.) I already tried to blame it on their divorce, but my mom's not buying it. I have to tell them. (Pause.) Okay. But I love you. I don't care if you gave me chlamydia. I LOVE YOU and I want to be with you and no one can stop us. Not my mother, not Marianne, not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Griffin has just hung up on her teenage lover and be freaking out. She grabs a cardboard box and begins throwi items into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive bursts into Mrs. Griffin's office and sees Mrs. Gri packing her things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we saw before -- 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive starts to say something, but Mrs. Griffin can't eve look at her.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws a framed photo of her and Mr. Griffin into the box. It shatters. Mrs. Griffin falls apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive starts to say something again, but she doesn't know what to say, so she sheepishly turns to leave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and then feels awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I was just looking for Marianne. Did she say something about being mad at me? She just smacked the shi -- `crap' out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes Mrs. Griffin cry even harder. She attempts to pull herself together.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: It's my fault. I'm so sorry, Olive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive looks at her, quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucked up. I fucking fucked up SO fucking bad. I'm a fucking.... Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong. I love it, but I don't think you're supposed to use those words around a student.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you're not to supposed to fuck them, either. But it didn't stop me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive puts two and two together in her head. She gasps a little louder than she planned. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and -- Oh my God. I'm not judging you or anything, but oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. What does that have to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Griffin walks over and locks her office door. She fights back more tears, as she tries to explain to Olive.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My guidance counselor, who had only days before armed me with a latex bulletproof vest, told me that she had chlamydia and that she had been screwing around with her office aide's boyfriend under the guise of divorce counseling. She confided in me that she and her husband - my favorite teacher - were having marital problems, that they hadn't slept together in months. She assured me that she had never meant for anything to happen with Micah. She confessed to me how when she was a child she always dreamt of being Maria Von Trapp, not Mary Kay Letorneau. Micah had panicked and used me as a scapegoat - to save her job and her marriage. She assured me that she would make sure everyone knew the truth and apologized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Griffin stops talking and waits for Olive to speak.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And I bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive gives her a reassuring smile, steps up to the plate offers up a solution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have chlamydia. And I could easily have given it to Micah. That time we slept together. Who knows? Often times women don't have symptoms and I have been whoring around....

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: No you haven't. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive looks at her, puzzled by her knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because a real whore can't admit it to herself, let alone others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive puts her hand on Mrs. Griffin's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Micah. Tell him I said he's an asshole and that he owes me SO big for this and also the time I pretended not to see him during a third grade game of hide and seek. Tell him I still remember that. But tell him that I confessed to giving him chlamydia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Griffin grabs Olive and cries on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's not really my place to say this, but I figure after the conversation we just had, I can speak candidly. Your husband is HOT and while the male adolescent can fuck like a bunny... who really wants to fuck a bunny? If I was you, I'd go home and seduce him and pretend this never happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive strokes her guidance counselor's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want some more condoms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you keep them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the webcam --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, really how could I be angry at Marianne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, if some bimbo gave MY boyfriend an STD, I'd have swung, but I'd have balled my fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boyfriend. (She gets lost in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the mythical play I was getting, it's a wonder - and probably a miracle - that I still hadn't actually been asked out on a real date. Guys were clamoring to claim that they'd slept with me, but no one was putting the real moves on me. Until finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two LITTLE 5 YEAR OLD GIRLS (Olive and Rhiannon) chase a LITTLE BOY all over the playground, desperate to kiss him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They plot and plan to corner him, but he's just too fast.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was really Rhiannon who had a crush on him. She has since we were kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhiannon finally catches him and kiss him on the cheek. Repulsed, he wipes his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhiannon and Olive high five each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive eats her lunch and yuks it up with a table full of guys. Rhiannon sits at a different table, mostly comprise of girls, and glares at her from across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell rings and the students begin getting up and maki their way toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anson (who we saw earlier with Rhiannon in the hallways) approaches Olive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Olive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive smiles sweetly at him. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you were busy tonight. Maybe wanna go out or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you have in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. I was thinking about chartering a hot air balloon, taking along a bottle of champagne and fresh fruit and then trying to impress you with an overzealous reading of Emily Dickinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Anson, are you inviting me to accompany you to a romantic dinner at the Red Lobster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unequivocally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. Yeah. I'll have dinner with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive walks off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive and Anson sit in a booth at a dimly-lit RED LOBSTER Olive looks beautiful. The `A' on her shirt is sequined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you brought me to the nicest restaurant in town. This is swank. I was beginning to think that there was no such thing as class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. What's better than getting to select your dinner and have nice conversation while they boil it alive in the back? 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Anson Jr. doesn't mind making the sacrifice. You don't mind that I named him Anson Jr., do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. I'm actually kind of honored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe this whole thing about lobster being an aphrodisiac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Lying out his ass) I didn't know it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, medical science has not substantiated claims that any particular food increases sexual desire or performance. It's so funny when guys ply women with food that they think is gonna get them laid. I mean, what's really sexy about slurping back oysters? You know, native people believed that you gained the strength of the animal by consuming it. Some people grind up rhinoceros horn, because it's thought to stiffen the male sex organ. It's all bullshit. And spanish fly? It's pulverized beetle that people eat! Although, it's illegal for human consumption in the United States and do you know why? Because if you take just a bit too much, it causes painful urination, fever and bloody discharge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERVER appears with their LOBSTER. Anson is an odd shad of green from Olive's little science lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The server leaves them and Olive digs in. Anson is feelin nauseous and can't touch his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the restaurant, a PARADE OF SERVERS enters fr the back, enthusiastically clapping and holding a cupcake 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leading the brigade is Meerkat Todd, who's wearing a RED LOBSTER HAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With as much spirit, as he has as a meerkat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know but I've been told!

dialogues.speaker: PARADE OF SERVERS
dialogues.text: I don't know but I've been told!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads them through to another part of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know Meerkat Todd worked here! And he's a lobster! I wonder if I should start calling him Lobster Todd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marguerite is getting old!

dialogues.speaker: PARADE OF SERVERS
dialogues.text: Marguerite is getting old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They land at the table of the birthday girl. Olive cranes her neck to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhiannon, miserable of course, sitting with her parents a table in the next room. Olive immediately becomes uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best thing is her dessert is free!

dialogues.speaker: PARADE OF SERVERS
dialogues.text: The best thing is her dessert is free!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worst thing is I sing off-key!

dialogues.speaker: PARADE OF SERVERS
dialogues.text: The worst thing is I sing off-key!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive is visibly squirming in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound off! 89.

dialogues.speaker: PARADE OF SERVERS
dialogues.text: Happy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound off!

dialogues.speaker: PARADE OF SERVERS
dialogues.text: Birthday!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound off!

dialogues.speaker: PARADE OF SERVERS
dialogues.text: Happy birthday to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole place applauds, unenthusiastically. Anson sees Olive's discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhiannon's over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? She's been in love with you since the first grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she's my best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you two weren't speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not, but it doesn't mean I should be out with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You asked me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. I have no interest in her. I mean, we're friends, but -- 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't see us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to get the check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures for the server who appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we get our check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just remembered I'm allergic to shellfish. I always forget that my respiratory system would collapse and I'd die. It sucks I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even more confused, the server obliges and gives them the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Digging in her purse) Let me get it. I have a gift certificate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls it out and hands it to the waitress, who leaves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I asked you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I ruined it, so let me bear the financial brunt. (Beat.) I'm so sorry about this. But she really likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and I just don't have much in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you and I do? 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. For instance, I, too think Nina Howell's a twat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, if that's our magical connection, I should date the entire school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive suddenly becomes self-conscious and a little bit pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, about that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The server reappears with the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a remaining balance of fourteen dollars and thirty six cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it. Tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sever smiles and leaves them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They duck out of the booth trying to keep their heads dow but Olive can't resist the urge to look up and see if Rhiannon sees them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive and Rhiannon make eye contact. Whereas, Olive looks remorseful, Rhiannon looks like she's just been stabbed i the back -- which she has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Abernathys see her, as well, and wave. It's painfully obvious to Olive that Rhi hasn't told her parents about t differences. She starts to go over, but Rhiannon's face i turning vermillion in anger. Olive just waves, sheepishly and leaves with Anson. 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive's face is painted with guilt. She feels like shit, doesn't want to externalize it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anson puts his hand on her knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive manages a smile. He reaches into his pocket and pul out a $500 GIFT CERTIFICATE to ANTHROPOLOGIE and hands it her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive is disappointed, but tries not to show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I didn't realize --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snapping out of her guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. So, what did we "do" on this date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever $500 gets me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans over and kisses her. She pushes him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. This isn't how it works. I don't actually --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's kissing her again, a little too forcibly. She pushes him off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get it. I'm not technically having sex with people for money. You know that, right? Besides, even if I was, we're in the parking lot of a Red Lobster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can go wherever you want, but I think it would be kind of hot here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I gotta go. It's been -- sad. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets out of the car. He rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive, you're being stupid. I'll take you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives off, leaving her outside in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As luck would have it, Meerkat Todd, is coming out the ba exit. He sees her and gives her a surprised, toothy grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Olive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Todd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm just hanging out in the parking lot. I do that sometimes. Not necessarily just here. The one outside of Applebee's is fun, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Laughing at her oddness) You want a ride somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend Rhi is inside. It's her Mom's birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears begin to glisten in Olive's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not my friend anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd walks over and puts his arm around her and leads her his car. He opens the door for her and she sits down. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive is trying to pull herself together but she can't st crying as Todd drives her home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd doesn't know what to say to her. Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's to say? I'm a horrible person. Everyone thinks I'm a whore and, for the first time, I'm starting to believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't act like you don't know what people are saying about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what people are saying. Doesn't mean I believe them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive, contrary to popular belief, I'm not an idiot. I know exactly what's going on and I know exactly what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one had to tell me. All I know is once upon a time, there was a scared little kid in a closet at a party who wasn't ready for his first kiss and there was this amazing little girl who lied for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles through her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember that? 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah and after I ran out, you pulled Brandon in. Yeah, I know about that, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And look how he turned out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I still pretend you were my first kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Who was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend. Rhiannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive's laughter turns to rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. About a year later. It sucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Blurting it out) She knew how I felt about you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did it first! And here I am feeling SOOOO bad and THAT BITCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. How do you feel about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felt! I said FELT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops the car. They're at her house. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off his look) I mean, it's not that I don't still feel that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an awkward moment between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive. If I promise not to tell anyone, could I kiss you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite the fact that this is positively the most romanti moment of her young life, Olive looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not tonight. I don't want you to kiss me when mascara's running down my cheek or some shithead has forced his tongue down my throat only a half-hour ago. I've wanted to kiss you since the eighth grade, but I want it to be perfect. And right now, my life's a mess. I need to get it under control before I drag you into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I told you I wanted to be dragged into it? Maybe I could help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out his hand and she takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I have a reason to fix this catastrophe I've brought upon myself. And I'm going to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles his goofy grin and she embraces him. She hops o of the car and goes to her front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into her webcam --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, now I had a reason for things to go back to the way that they were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth needed to be told and I knew I had to go the one person who could help me. The one person I could count on to set the story straight. Brandon. I'd helped him and, even though it would destroy his new reputation for being a stud, I knew he would help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filling the frame, a GOSSIPY GIRL in braces says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, did you hear that Brandon ran away from home? Yeah. Totally. He left his parents a note that said: `Eff you, I'm gay.' And then he skipped town with a big, hulking black guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We spin around to see Olive's stunned reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My apologies to Mark Twain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reality of the situation begins to weigh on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defeated, Olive makes her way through the crowded halls.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It gets worse. Due to his `condition,' Micah was sent on an extended visit to his grandparents in Mississippi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micah, beyond miserable, sits between his STERN GRANDPARE who read the Bible to him. 98.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No telephone, no television, no computer, no internet and - most importantly - no diseased sexual partners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micah settles in for a very long visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where they had previously met, Olive pleads with Evan.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I went to everyone I'd helped and begged them to say it wasn't true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. I gave you money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Evan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off, leaving her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive waits for Mrs. Griffin's response. There's a long moment of contemplation on Mrs. Griffin's part. Then --

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Olive, life is full of choices. I made a bad one. But then, so did you. We both acted unwisely, but I don't see any other alternative than to live with the guilt. My guilt stems from my indiscretion, yours for lying. We've made our choices. Now, we have to ride them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pissed as hell) Or I could just tell everyone THE TRUTH.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Fine, Olive. Let's play the `who do you believe' game. But, first, ask yourself, if you were an adult, who would you believe? 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, Mrs. Griffin, you're a fucking cunt.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Because you helped me once, I'm not going to report that to Principal Gibbons. Now, we're even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're locked in a Mexican standoff.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, Olive throws the door open and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Griffin is erasing the blackboard, when Olive storms the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife has chlamydia and she's been sleeping with a student and she gave it to him and now she's trying to blame me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shocked, Mr. Griffin drops the eraser.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gravity of what she's just done sinks in and she stumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- I'm sorry. I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not knowing what to say, she runs from his classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive is mirthless, as she proceeds with her story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking back, that's the thing I regret the most. That's the thing that sent me to the church, er, churches. And that's the thing that made me realize how profoundly I'd fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's something I'll have to live with for the rest of my life. With my words, even though they were true, I ended a marriage. No kid should have to be burdened with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She contemplates this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we saw before, Olive sits and plays `CONNECT FOUR' wit Mr. Griffin, at his desk. Both are looking beaten down an very depressed and their minds are on everything but the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Griffin puts his hand on Olive's.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive gets a tear in her eyes. She puts a RED CHIP in at top and loses the game. She reaches over and presses the lever, causing all of the chips to fall on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a ridiculously tall tower of blocks and they all down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rakes the chips and the game into his own cardboard bo full of his things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles and she hugs him -- intensely, tears quickly welling up in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: No. It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just hold each other. Finally, Mr. Griffin pulls awa and takes his things and starts to leave. But then he tur and says -- 101.

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hope that you and Todd end up okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: MR. GRIFFIN
dialogues.text: Not sure yet. Away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share one last, pained smile and he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearfelt, into the webcam --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Griffin, if you ever see this, just know - I was wrong to tell you that. In that way. At all. I don't know. I shouldn't have done it. I don't feel bad for lying for your wife. But I hate myself for telling you the truth. I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wipes away a tear, pulls herself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part Five: Not With a Whimper But With a Bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we saw before --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cross Your Heart Club is assembled outside of the sch with a lot of other kids (and some parents), waving signs wooden stakes that say things like:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhi is among them, as riled up as any. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive steps out of the school to see the demonstration. h jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things have gotten WAY too out of hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive cries on her bed, clutching her teddy bear. Rosemar listens, as a good mother does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, now everyone who knows the truth is either gone or won't fess up. The Cross Your Legs Club is demanding my head. And the messed up thing is that I wouldn't put it past Gibbons to expel me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a similar situation when I was your age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone called you a whore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I had a horrible reputation and people said awful things about me. But it was true. I was a slut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive gives her a suspicious look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm waiting for you to say (Imitating her mother) `Just kidding!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's true. I slept with a whole bunch of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well! It was a different time. 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ewwww!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. I got around. Before I met your father, I was a garden variety floozy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I endured a similar lynching because of a certain dalliance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise that it was no worse than Marianne Bryant's attack on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna bet? It was her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Don Bryant and I got caught in a very compromising position in the locker room during a basketball game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's disgusting! He's disgusting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't back then. He was actually pretty handsome. All I'm saying is that MAYBE the reason that Bryant girl is going after you is because her mother told her about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, the sins of the mother are revisited on the daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something else you should know. This is hard to say but -- Don Bryant is your father. Marianne is your sister. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive turns white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidding!! Well, about the sister thing, but not about the Don thing. That happened. Actually that happened a couple of times before we got caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive punches her mother on the arm, who's laughing hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you so much right now. Can't you see I'm a mess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not, Olive. You're wonderful. And you're going to handle this the same way that I did. With an incontrovertible sense of humor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace and Olive gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the pep talk, Mom. Now get out. I need to make some phone calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosemary looks slightly concerned by the grin on Olive's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We join a pep rally, already in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DANCE TEAM attempts to rile up the school with a rous rendition of Michael Jackson's `BAD.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the stands, Rhi sits with Marianne and Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Olive wasn't at school today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She extends her palms to Nina and Rhi, who both slap them Marianne puts her arm around Rhi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you're with us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. You guys fucking rock. 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't say that word, Rhiannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just say `effing' instead. We effing rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne nods in agreement, however Rhi is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But isn't that just implying the same word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Rhiannon. We have so much to teach you. It's okay to imply things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhiannon looks at her new best friends, who just smile at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song ends and there's a drum roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yay! It's time for Meerkat Todd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to rip that costume off him and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marianne puts her hand firmly on Rhi's knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just not talk for a while, okay hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rhi puts her head down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drum roll ends and Meerkat Todd bounces out in costum He jumps around enthusing the student body --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then he goes out of the gym and reenters pushing a DUMPSTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The familiar chords of the James Bond theme `Nobody Does Better' plays from the band.

dialogues.text: Meerkat Todd opens the lid of the dumpster and Olive, dre in a glittery and slinky RED DRESS, with a BOA draped aro her bare shoulder, pops up and croons with a handheld mic slightly different lyrics: 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody does it better. Makes me feel sad for the rest. Nobody does it half as good as me. Baby, I'm the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd lifts Olive out of the dumpster and she sings her as off - and she's quite good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't lookin,' But somehow they found me. I tried to hide from Your love light. But like heaven above me The guys who loved me Are keepin' all my secrets safe tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winks at the audience. The guys begin to wolf whistle and howl at her sheer brilliance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to rub her hands seductively over Meerkat Todd furry costume, eventually unzipping it and taking off the head to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUE DEVIL TODD! The crowd goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And nobody does it better Though sometimes I wish someone could. Nobody does it quite the way I do. Why'd I have to be so good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She saunters over to Rhi and kisses her on the cheek, lea a big, red lip mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way that they hold me Whenever they hold me There's some kind of magic inside you. That keeps me from runnin', But just keep it comin'! How'd you learn to do the things you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees that Gibbons is not amused, but that doesn't sto her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and nobody does it better. Makes me feel sad for the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody does it half as good as me. Baby, baby! Darlin', I'm the best!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over to a couple of HORN PLAYERS, and runs her fingers seductively over their (uh) instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd goes wild - some appalled, but most enthused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive sashays through the crowd as the MALE TEENS scream stuff money down her bodice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby you're the best! Darlin', you're the best! Baby, you're the best!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the student body) This is just a free preview. For the main event log on to www.freeolivep.com tonight at 6 p.m. Now, I know this conflicts with tonight's basketball game, but c'mon would you rather be here cheering on the Meerkats (Looking at Todd,

dialogues.text: or watch me do one.

dialogues.text: There are audible gasps, but excitement nonetheless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibbons angrily storms over and takes the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Through gritted teeth) Young lady, to my office. NOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can't. I'm gonna go bang my boyfriend while the whole school watches. But good luck with the game-thing. Go Meerkats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She plods out, triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is setting as Olive speaks into her webcam. But t time, we're not seeing it through the lens, but from a different point in the room. 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here you all are. Waiting outside the closet door for me to kiss Todd, listening to me pretend to have sex with Brandon, paying me to lie for you, calling probably the last virgin in school a whore. Guys. Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of a sudden -- from outside and downstairs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James' `LAID' begins to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive goes over to the window and sees Todd below, holdin a BOOMBOX (a la John Cusack) and there's a RIDE-ON LAWN M (a la Patrick Dempsey) behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upon seeing this, she bursts into laughter, but it couldn be more romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you that I loved this song?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you've been watching my live webcast. It's still going on, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck them. They've had enough of you. Well, figuratively speaking. I borrowed my neighbor's John Deere. Come down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That rhymed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intentionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive can't get the smile off of her face as she goes bac the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see her through the lens. 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Todd. Not that I owe any of you any more confessions, but I'm really in love with him. And I am going to lose my virginity to him. I'm not sure when. It could happen five minutes from now or tonight or six months from now or maybe on our wedding night, but the really amazing thing is that it's nobody's business. (As an afterthought) Like, totally.

dialogues.text: She turns the camera off.

dialogues.text: Olive runs out of the house and tackles him, kissing him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: The basketball game is going on to an almost empty gymnas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A proud Brandon watches from a hotel room. A MUSCULAR BLACK GUY in a towel comes up behind him and kisses his n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Micah? What are you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had better not be on the sin- ternet.

dialogues.text: -- Rosemary and Dill are too busy making out to watch.
